actions.text: Read second time and referred to Senate Committee on Judiciary.

official_title: A bill to provide protection from requirements and prohibitions imposed upon citizens of the United States by foreign nations concerning the disclosure of confidential business information, and for other purposes.
short_title: Protection of Confidential Business Information Act of 1981

summary.text: Protection of Confidential Business Information Act of 1981 - Authorizes the Attorney General to: (1) require any person subject to U.S. jurisdiction to give notice of any requirement imposed upon him by a foreign nation concerning the disclosure of confidential business information; and (2) order that the information required not be disclosed. Provides that no sanction for nondisclosure imposed by a foreign nation shall be enforceable in a U.S. court if an order of the Attorney General was promulgated.

titles.title: Protection of Confidential Business Information Act of 1981

A bill to provide protection from requirements and prohibitions imposed upon citizens of the United States by foreign nations concerning the disclosure of confidential business information, and for other purposes.
